name: State_11

timeline_beats.label: Open-Seas Treaty, boundary recalibration, trade-bloc accession

factions.label: Maritime Guilds
factions.influence_hint: controls ports, tariffs, and most licensed long-distance cargo

factions.label: Shipwrights' Authority
factions.influence_hint: dominant in shipbuilding, repair yards, and fortification logistics

factions.label: Naval Command
factions.influence_hint: state navy and coastal defenses; shapes security and foreign posture

factions.label: Tide-Temple Priests
factions.influence_hint: manage navigational auguries and ritual rites tied to sea-lanes

factions.label: Merchant Gentry
factions.influence_hint: finances reagent imports, re-export networks, and overseas agents

traits: ritual tattooing and sea-bound initiation rites
widespread bilingualism with Island Creole in ports

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
State must respect existing alliances, treaties, and recent maritime boundary adjustments
notes: Coastal chokepoints and mainport fortifications are strategic priorities
Economy dependent on imported ritual reagents; reagent supply affects naval augury capability
Memberships in A1, A4 and TB1 create overlapping obligations and potential conflicts
Maritime boundary (BC2) remains a flashpoint with neighboring states
Naval traditions and religious auguries are integrated; control of Tide-Temple shapes legitimacy
